Articles.Content:
Muziker has been merged with Chatterer

v.0.1.1 [14 Aug]

- Added layered audio instead of one single AudioSource

  • Two background sources playing on loop for vessel "hum"
  • Two random ambient tracks playing simultaneously for eerie effects (This turned out more cacophonic than I thought and will be changed)

v.0.1 [13 Aug]

- Initial release

Edited November 16, 2013 by Iannic-ann-od

What the heck is all this text.

Also, no pictures, vauge details, no video, uhh..

@The Destroyer: Its some sort of audio mod so pictures would be useless but I agree a video or demo of the sounds/music would be helpful in determining if its worth the DL or not.

@OP: I would suggest you put a more descriptive description and possibly a video demoing the music/sounds you have provided here. Most people don't want to go through modding their game just to find out they don't like the mod.

It's a music replacer plugin that plays what's in the folder as long as it's ogg with a interval, volume and skip track ingame option menu Very helpful to select matching music or even audio tracks in-game without alt-tabbing, but then it also uses precious and limited ram of KSP for this. Although only a small amount.

Tested and works Does exactly what it says in the description by the way

Another totally useless plugin to play some eerie space soundscapes

That's what it does, and it does it well.
Ok just listened to video. Seriously that's gonna give me nightmares.

Ok just listened to video. Seriously that's gonna give me nightmares.

I know, isn't it great! With some effort on my part to make it a bit more configurable and useable, I think it could be a decent alternative to the stock music.
Can we merge it all together with Chattererererer and make it an option to turn on? This looks great!

Can we merge it all together with Chattererererer and make it an option to turn on? This looks great!

I will most likely end up doing this. It was really nice to take a day and not look at chatterererer, though.
I can understand that! Great work!
You know, if you start having the screen randomly static out and add some creepy metallic creaks we could have an interesting dead space vibe.
Oh my, a music replacer? I'm shoveling the Homeworld soundtrack into this.
Can we have music only when we get into space, just like the original KSP way (and also the OrbiterSound way)?

You know, if you start having the screen randomly static out and add some creepy metallic creaks we could have an interesting dead space vibe.

I prefer my Kerbals not to kill themselves out of the fear something is about to rip they're arms off and puke on their face melting it off.

Loaded up a whole bunch of AC/DC and Pink Floyd.

Let there be rock!

This mod is one of my favorites now.

This game gets better all the time.

Is it possible to have more of these folders, for maybe flying through the atmosphere on kerbin or decoupling lots of stuff in atmosphere, If those were possible I could probably put top gun or something in there cause missiles
I've been working on music for ksp as an add-on then someone gave me a link to this mod and it looks great, if you need more audio tracks just tell me.

Oh man this is great.

But I need a menu to play them from. Just having them play randomly isn't as fun. Like Top Gun music when you are crashing into the mun. Or something.

I have this installed, the Muziker volume bar pops up, but I've never had any of the tracks play. Does it have any other sort of dependancies I've missed? Should I turn off the volume to the stock music? Or keep it turned up? Thanks!
YES! Now my kerbals can listen to dubstep all the way to the MÃƒÂ¼n! XD
I like the music but am hoping for more controls. Hiding the window, for example.

Remember the soundtrack to Total Annihilation? Perfect

Aaaaah god this brings me back (listening to it on youtube right now)

Time for some super-dramatic space voyages...

I like the music but am hoping for more controls. Hiding the window, for example.

Yeah, for sure. I'd love to see this mod turn into a full-fledged jukebox ship part, frankly.

edit: Actually, nevermind, I now hope this plugin is revived: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/12550-0-15-Really-Advanced-Computer-Systems-Rev-1-1-Music-Player!-Countdown-inside!

Edited October 23, 2013 by Franklin
Not really sure if this is necro, but does this till function properly?
